column7: the sample also contains elongated fluorescent structures. These needle like structures are large micrometer sized NR aggregates. b) At a lower NR concentration of 2 ¬µM the 2¬µm PS beads are still visible
column8: while needle like structures that can easily be identified as NR aggregates are rare. However

column12: b to c and d.|Nile Red staining for nanoplastic quantification: Overcoming the challenge of false positive counts due to fluorescent aggregates|Swarupa Chatterjee

[BMIM][PF6] ionic liquid and Nafion‚Ñ¢ polymers
column4: gas-phase interface|Figure 1. Propylene can be separated from propane-containing gas mixture via selective capture and release of alkene molecules facilitated by a Membrane Electrode Assembly (MEA) as depicted above in the top-right. The MEA‚Äôs reaction surface consists of a layer of Porous Gas-Diffusing Electrodes that is made primarily of carbon nanoparticles scaffolded by a hybrid ionogel mixture of [BMIM][PF6] ionic liquid and Nafion‚Ñ¢ polymers. SEM images of the porous electrode/ionogel structures are shown in the top-left. Ni(mnt)2 n species are dispersed within the iongel whose close vicinity to both the carbon electrode surface and the gas-phase interface containing propane/propylene mixture allows electrochemically modulated complexation and de-complexation with propylene via a reversible redox olefin separation process. The selective pi-bond complexation affinity between propylene and Ni(mnt)2 n
column5: is dependent on the oxidation state of Ni(mnt)2 n as depicted in the lower-left. At an oxidation state of 0
column6: propylene can complex to the Ni(mnt)2 species
column7: while at an oxidation state of -2
column8: complexation is not favored. The sample MEA is installed into an Electrochemical Flow Cell Device
column10: which is connected to a potentiostat (for modulating potential in the MEA)
column11: a mass flow control meter feeding propane/propylene gas mixture or nitrogen to the MEA during appropriate phases of the experiment (refer to Figure 2.)
column12: and a GC to measure the concentration of the outlet gas stream. Because the flow cell device requires a counter electrode and a balanced ion transfer in the central Nafion-117 membrane
column13: water oxidation and reduction were utilized on the side opposite to the gas-separating side of the flow cell.|Electrochemically Modulated Separation of Olefin-Paraffin Gas Mixtures in Membrane Electrode Assemblies|Toshihiro Akashige
